questions.question_text:
Which TWO are mandatory requirements for a PRINCE2 project?
1. It is applying the PRINCE2 principles
2. It is meeting the minimum requirements set out in the PRINCE2 themes
3. It is using PRINCE2 recommended techniques
4. It is tailoring PRINCE2 to the needs of the users

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
To successfully apply PRINCE2, the project must follow the principles and meet the minimum requirements of the themes, which provide the essential structure for effective project management. Tailoring and techniques can be adapted based on the specific needs of the project.

Selected Answer: A
I don't believe it's mandatory to meet all of the theme mins?
A is answer, but beware Themes is renamed Practices.

Selected Answer: A
It's obviously A

Selected Answer: D
The 'Managing a Stage Boundary' process involves reviewing and updating the Project Initiation Document (PID) as necessary. This is particularly important to ensure that the project’s delivery plan and business justification remain valid, especially when external factors could affect the project. During this process, the Project Board will assess whether any changes or new risks need to be reflected in the PID, and whether adjustments are required to keep the project aligned with the business case and overall objectives.

D = correct; Why the other options are less suitable:

A. Starting up a project: This process focuses on the initial setup of the project and the creation of the PID.
B. Initiating a project: This process is about defining the project in detail and creating the initial plans.
C. Controlling a stage: This process is about managing the day-to-day activities within a stage, not the overall review of the PID at stage boundaries.

D. "objectives of managing a stage boundary" - #3

Further information on the objectives of managing a stage boundary: 
1. Assure project board: that all products in the stage plan have been completed and
approved. 
2. Prepare stage or exception plan: for the next management stage. 
***3. Review and update: the project initiation documentation. 
4. Provide information: for the project board to assess the continuing viability of the
project. 
5. Record information: or lessons that can help later management stages of this project
and/or other projects.
6. Request authorization: to start the next management stage.
For exceptions, the objectives of the process of managing a stage boundary are similar
to those listed above but include preparing an exception plan and seeking approval to
replace the project or current stage plan with the exception plan

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. In an initiation stage a PID is created, not reviewed.
I believe D is correct here if anyone can confirm

questions.question_text: In which process is the PID reviewed and, if necessary, updated to reflect external factors that may affect the delivery and business justification of the project?
Which is an objective of the Initiating a Project process?

discussion.content: C is correct: 16.2 How the corporate, programme management or customer method will be tailored to suit the project.

choices.A: Develop the corporate quality management system as part of the Project Initiation Documentation
choices.D: Request authority from corporate management to deliver the project
choices.C: Summarize how the organization's project management method will be tailored for the project
choices.B: Prepare the plans for the subsequent stages

choices.D: A description of the customer's quality expectations
choices.C: An analysis of the power and influence of the major stakeholders
choices.B: Documentation of the project management team structure
choices.A: Definition of the training required throughout the project

questions.question_text: What should be included in the PID as a minimum requirement for managing organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Per https://prince2.wiki/management-products/project-initiation-documentation/

B: Quality Criteria for PID: The project management team (PMT) structure is complete, with names, titles, links to role descriptions and some indication that people are aware of their roles.

questions.question_text: How should the 'managing product delivery' process be used?

choices.D: As a way to allow team managers to create their own work packages
choices.A: As a way of obtaining project acceptance from the project board
choices.B: As an alternative to using the PRINCE2 quality review technique
choices.C: As an interface to third party suppliers that are not using PRINCE2

discussion.content:
I think correct anwer is C. From 18.3: If the project uses external suppliers that are not using PRINCE2, managing product delivery provides a
statement of the required interface between the team manager and the PRINCE2 method being used in the
project by the project manager

Selected Answer: C
The 'Managing Product Delivery' process ensures that the project team delivers the agreed-upon products to the project’s quality criteria, within time and cost constraints. It provides a clear framework for delivering products and managing the work packages assigned to the team. One of its roles is to manage the interface between the project and third-party suppliers or other external parties who may not be using PRINCE2. This ensures that all external parties understand the project’s requirements, expectations, and standards, even if they are not familiar with the PRINCE2 methodology.

Selected Answer: C
Agree is C.
